required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Assess The Safety And Efficacy Of SU11248 In Patients With Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor(GIST)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Of SU011248 In The Treatment Of Patients With Imatinib Mesylate (Gleevec Tm, Glivec)-Resistant Or Intolerant Malignant Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: A study to assess the safety and efficacy of SU11248 in patients with gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) whose disease has failed imatinib therapy or who were intolerant to imatinib treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed by Imaging Studies at End of Double-blind Treatment Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each 6-week cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed in the Double-blind Treatment Phase at End of Study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each 6-week cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase after Last Subject Last Visit (LSLV)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug
clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.time_frame: clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Confirmed Objective Response (CR or PR) in Subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Health State Profile Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 & 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

intervention.description: 50 mg taken orally once a day. 6 week treatment cycle (Schedule 4/2) 4 weeks on study drug/2 weeks off study drug.
50 mg taken orally once a day. 6 week treatment cycle (Schedule 4/2) 4 weeks on study drug/2 weeks off study drug.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically-proven diagnosis of malignant GIST not amenable to surgery, radiation or combined modality treatment with curative intent
- Failed Gleevec treatment or intolerant to Gleevec therapy
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with any chemotherapy, chemoembolization therapy, immunotherapy, or investigational agent since the last dose of Gleevec

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Enrollment began (medical clinic) in December 2003. Study was unblinded on 27 January 2005 (end of Double-blind treatment). Subjects experiencing disease progression could crossover to Open-label treatment. Open-label data collection ended May 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 361 subjects randomized to double-blind treatment in 2:1 ratio (sunitinib vs. Placebo). 255 subjects continued on or crossed over to Open-label treatment.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

group.title: Sunitinib Open-Label Treatment
group.description: Subjects experiencing disease progression could have their treatment assignment unblinded, and subjects who had been receiving placebo could crossover to open-label treatment with sunitinib; subjects who had been receiving sunitinib during double-blind treatment of the study could continue to do so after unblinding if, in the opinion of the investigator, there was sufficient evidence of clinical benefit.

participants_list.participants: Defined:subjects completed double-blind treatment phase and/or entered open-label treatment phase.
Defined:subjects completed double-blind treatment phase and/or entered open-label treatment phase.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed by Imaging Studies at End of Double-blind Treatment Phase
outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each 6-week cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: From the Intent to Treat (ITT) population, 82 subjects on sunitinib treatment were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase and were included in TTP analysis. 67 subjects on placebo were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed by Imaging Studies at End of Double-blind Treatment Phase
measure.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).
measure.population: From the Intent to Treat (ITT) population, 82 subjects on sunitinib treatment were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase and were included in TTP analysis. 67 subjects on placebo were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase.

analysis.groups_desc: The study was designed to test the null hypothesis that the median TTP from placebo treatment is 4 months versus the alternative hypothesis that the median TTP from sunitinib treatment is at least 6 months with an overall 2-sided significance level of 0.05 and power of 90%.
analysis.p_value_desc: The nominal levels of significance for the interim and final analyses were determined at the time of the analyses using the Lan-DeMets procedure with an O’Brien-Fleming stopping rule.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause (on treatment or within 28 days of last dose).
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause (on treatment or within 28 days of last dose).

analysis.p_value_desc: No p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Overall Survival Status of Subjects
outcome.description: Number of subjects alive at end of study.
outcome.time_frame: clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug
outcome.population: ITT population; Number subjects Dead = 176, 90 (sunitinib, placebo respectively). Subjects who were not known to be dead at the time the database was closed for analysis were censored on the date they were last known to be alive.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

analysis.p_value_desc: No p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons.

outcome.description: time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause (rank preserving structural failure time method).
outcome.time_frame: clinic visit or telephone contact every 2 months for up to 3 years from the last dose of study drug

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

measure.title: Overall Survival Based on the Rank Preserving Structural Failure Time Method
measure.description: time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause (rank preserving structural failure time method).

analysis.p_value_desc: No p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI for Hazard Ratio is from 2.5% and 97.5% Empirical Percentiles of 100,000 Bootstraps.

outcome.title: Best Overall Tumor Response During Double-blind Treatment Phase
outcome.description: Tumor response according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Best Overall Tumor Response During Double-blind Treatment Phase
measure.description: Tumor response according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).

outcome.title: Confirmed Objective Response (CR or PR) in Subjects
outcome.description: Overall confirmed objective response = confirmed Complete Response (CR) OR confirmed Partial Response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed responses were those that persisted on repeat imaging study ≥ 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Confirmed Objective Response (CR or PR) in Subjects
measure.description: Overall confirmed objective response = confirmed Complete Response (CR) OR confirmed Partial Response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed responses were those that persisted on repeat imaging study ≥ 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

analysis.estimate_desc: Used exact method based on binomial distribution.

analysis.p_value_desc: No p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Response (TTR)
outcome.description: Time from date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor response that was subsequently confirmed. TTR was only calculated for the subgroup of subjects with a confirmed objective tumor response.
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: ITT population. Number of subjects analyzed = number of subjects with tumor response.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Time to Tumor Response (TTR)
measure.description: Time from date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor response that was subsequently confirmed. TTR was only calculated for the subgroup of subjects with a confirmed objective tumor response.
measure.population: ITT population. Number of subjects analyzed = number of subjects with tumor response.

outcome.title: Duration of Performance Status Maintenance
outcome.description: Time from randomization until the last time the performance status was no worse than at baseline or to death due to cancer in the absence of previous documentation of performance status worsening.
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: ITT Population. Number of subjects at median observed to have status worsening or died before status worsening.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Duration of Performance Status Maintenance
measure.description: Time from randomization until the last time the performance status was no worse than at baseline or to death due to cancer in the absence of previous documentation of performance status worsening.
measure.population: ITT Population. Number of subjects at median observed to have status worsening or died before status worsening.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed in the Double-blind Treatment Phase at End of Study
outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of each 6-week cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase after Last Subject Last Visit (LSLV)
outcome.population: From the Intent to Treat (ITT) population, 91 subjects on sunitinib treatment were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase and were included in TTP analysis. 73 subjects on placebo were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP) as Assessed in the Double-blind Treatment Phase at End of Study
measure.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression based on the assessment of an independent, third-party imaging laboratory using RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors).
measure.population: From the Intent to Treat (ITT) population, 91 subjects on sunitinib treatment were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase and were included in TTP analysis. 73 subjects on placebo were observed to have disease progression during blinded phase.

analysis.method_desc: log—rank test of treatment stratified by prior imatinib mesylate response and McGill Pain Questionnaire's Present Pain Intensity score

outcome.title: Time to Pain Progression Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
outcome.description: 25th Quartile: Time to Progression. Progression: a) No change (NC) in MPQ-PPI score (0=no pain to 5=excruciating pain) with increase total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline OR b) Increase score >= 1 point with either NC in total analgesic use or increase total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline. (50th Quartile not achieved.)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 & 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: Pain-Relief-Response population. Subjects at 25th Quartile with pain progress during blinded phase.

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Time to Pain Progression Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
measure.description: 25th Quartile: Time to Progression. Progression: a) No change (NC) in MPQ-PPI score (0=no pain to 5=excruciating pain) with increase total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline OR b) Increase score >= 1 point with either NC in total analgesic use or increase total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline. (50th Quartile not achieved.)
measure.population: Pain-Relief-Response population. Subjects at 25th Quartile with pain progress during blinded phase.

outcome.title: Subjects With Pain Relief Response Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
outcome.description: MPQ-PPI: 0=no pain to 5= excruciating pain. Pain Relief Response= 1) Decrease by >= 1 points in MPQ-PPI score with either Decrease or No Change in total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline OR 2) No change in MPQ-PPI score with Decrease total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 & 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Subjects With Pain Relief Response Using McGill Pain Questionnaire-present Pain Intensity (MPQ-PPI)
measure.description: MPQ-PPI: 0=no pain to 5= excruciating pain. Pain Relief Response= 1) Decrease by >= 1 points in MPQ-PPI score with either Decrease or No Change in total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline OR 2) No change in MPQ-PPI score with Decrease total analgesic use >= 50% over baseline.

analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI of Difference based on normal distribution. Percent = (number of subjects with response per total subjects per treatment in defined analysis population)*100.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Score in EuroQoL Visual Analog Scale (EQ-VAS)
outcome.description: Change: median score at observation minus median score at baseline. EQ-VAS score on the self-rated “thermometer,” indicating the patient's own assessment of their health status from 0 (worst) to 100 (best) imaginable health state.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 & 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: ITT population. Number subjects with evaluable data: (n=sunitinib, placebo)

group.title: Sunitinib Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting dose: 50 mg orally once daily as a single agent for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks. (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind Treatment
group.description: Starting daily dose of 1 capsule, size- and color-matched to the sunitinib 50-mg capsule for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week off-treatment period to form a complete cycle of 6 weeks (Schedule 4/2). Subjects received best supportive care in addition to the study treatment. Subjects were provided the opportunity to receive open-label sunitinib at the time of confirmed disease progression or study unblinding.

measure.title: Change From Baseline Score in EuroQoL Visual Analog Scale (EQ-VAS)
measure.description: Change: median score at observation minus median score at baseline. EQ-VAS score on the self-rated “thermometer,” indicating the patient's own assessment of their health status from 0 (worst) to 100 (best) imaginable health state.
measure.population: ITT population. Number subjects with evaluable data: (n=sunitinib, placebo)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Health State Profile Index
outcome.description: Change: median index score at observation minus median index score at baseline. EQ-5D is a generic instrument that describes health status in 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression, usual activities) with a weighted health Index based on general population values where where 0.0 = death and 1.0 = perfect health.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 & 28 of each cycle : duration of double-blind treatment phase
outcome.population: ITT Population. Number subjects with evaluable data: (n=sunitinib, placebo)

EQ-5D is a generic instrument that describes health status in 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression, usual activities) with a weighted health Index based on general population values where where 0.0 = death and 1.0 = perfect health.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Hand and foot syndrome secondary to sickle cell anaemia

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Duration of Tumor Response could not be reliably estimated at the time of analysis.
